author: lavozdegalicia
title: El Baxi Ferrol hace historia en la Eurocup Women
text:
Las ferrolanas se meten en cuartos de final tras ganar en casa de cinco puntos e igualar a 60 puntos el partido de vuelta contra el DVTK de Hungría
16 ene 2025 . Actualizado a las 22:17 h.El Baxi Ferrol sigue haciendo historia en la Eurocup Women. Las ferrolanas se metieron el los cuartos de final, es decir entre los ocho mejores clubes de esta competición continental, tras eliminar al DVTK de Hungría. Las ferrolanas, que habían ganado por cinco puntos el partido de ida (78-73) disputado en A Malata, empataron a 60 puntos en partido de vuelta en tierras húngaras.
Las ferrolanas volvieron a dejar patente que nunca se rinden. Llegaron a ir perdiendo por 21 puntos en un partido en el que no les salía casi nada, aunque ofrecieron una exhibición en el último cuarto con un parcial de 13-31 que les llevó a empatar el encuentro y pasar la eliminatoria.
Desde el primer minuto de juego del partido en Hungría quedó patente la intensidad defensiva del equipo húngaro, que defendió con mucha intensidad y que contó con el apoyo de un ruidoso público. El Baxi comenzó bien en defensa, aunque se atascó en ataque. Intentó meter balones interiores a Claire Melia, que siempre lo tuvo difícil ante una defensa de ayudas con jugadores con un físico superior. Desde el exterior tampoco hubo acierto. El mejor ataque llegó en las transiciones, aunque las ferrolanas tampoco estuvieron finas en el rebote. El primer cuarto acabó con un prometedor 11-10, que denotaba la igualdad entre los dos equipos, así como que las defensas se habían impuesto a los ataques.
En el segundo cuarto el Baxi no estuvo bien, no encontró la forma de jugar balones interiores y tampoco acertó desde el exterior. Se fue al descanso con cero triples de ocho lanzamientos. Sin juego interior y sin acierto desde el exterior el Baxi tan solo pudo sumar seis puntos en los diez minutos. El DVTK jugó buenos balones interiores a Ana Tadic, que se fue al descanso con nueve puntos en su cuenta. Además, también estuvieron acertadas desde el exterior por lo que ganaron este segundo cuarto por una buena ventaja 16-6.
El resultado en el descanso fue de 27-16, once puntos de ventaja que encarrilaban el partido y la eliminatoria a favor del equipo húngaro.
Tras los dos primeros cuartos Ana Tadic, 9 puntos, fue la máxima anotadora del DVTK mientras que Ángela y Noa Morro, con cuatro puntos, fueron las máximas anotadoras de las ferrolanas.
Ángela Mataix, que logró 29 puntos en la ida, estuvo siempre muy sujeta por Charles, mientras que Gala Mestres recibió un golpe en la cara en los primeros minutos por lo estuvo varios minutos sentada en el banquillo. También jugó Moira Joiner, diez minutos entre los dos primeros cuartos, aunque se quedó en cero puntos.
Con once puntos de desventaja el Baxi necesitaba reaccionar en el tercer cuarto, impedir que las húngaras rompieran ya el partido. El Baxi siguió en la misma dinámica que en el segundo cuarto, no le salió casi nada, dando una imagen de impotencia frente a un cuadro húngaro superior. A los 25 minutos, con un parcial de 9-2, el marcador era ya de 36-18. Lino pidió un tiempo muerto para tratar de recomponer a sus equipo, aunque el marcador estaba ya muy cuesta arriba.
El Baxi nunca bajó los brazos y dos triples de Moira Joiner y una canasta de Ángela Mataix llevaron el marcador a un 39-26. Un dos más uno de Tadic volvió a lanzar a las húngaras con un 42-26, llegándose al final del tercer cuarto con un tanteo de 47-29.
El Baxi jugó su mejor baloncesto en el último cuarto, con una mejora en defensa y acierto en el tiro. Un parcial de 6-13 llevó el marcador a un 53-42 a falta de seis minutos para el final, que daba vida a las ferrolanas, que tenían cinco puntos de ventaja del partido de ida.
Todo el equipo estuvo increíble en este último cuarto, en especial Gala Mestres y Ángela Mataix. Tras lo sufrido en los tres cuartos anteriores, el Baxi logró empatar el encuentro a 60 puntos y pasar la eliminatoria.
Ficha Técnica
60: DVTK de Hungría. Kayla Charles (6), Nina Aho, Reka Lekic (2), Monika Grigaluskyte (7), Miliva Jovanovic (8) —quinteto inicial— Melinda Miklos (7), Verónica Kanyasi (6), Ana Tadic (19) y Alexis Gulbe (5).
60: Baxi Ferrol. Alba Sánchez-Ramos (2), Pospisilová (4), Gala Mestres (16), Ángela Mataix (16), Claire Melia —quinteto inicial— Noa Morro (6), Moira Joiner (8), Jori Davis (1) y carlota Menéndez (7).
PARCIALES EN LOS CUARTOS: 11-10, 16-6. El resultado en el descanso fue de 27-16. El parcial en el tercer cuarto fue de 20-13 y en el último de 13-31.
ÁRBITROS: Parlak (Polonia), Mekenova (Eslovaquia) y Bijedic (Bosnia Herzegovina.
Un equipo italiano en los cuartos de final
Todo indica que el próximo rival del Baxi Ferrol en los cuartos de final de la Eurocup será el Dinamo Sassari de Italia, en concreto de la localidad de Palaserradimiongni. El partido de ida se disputará en tierras italianas el jueves, día 20 de febrero, mientras que el encuentro de vuelta, en el pabellón de A Malata, está previsto para el jueves, día 27 de febrero. Al igual que la disputada frente al DVTK de Hungría será una eliminatoria a cara de perro para las ferrolanas, ya que las italianas son uno de los mejores equipos de baloncesto femenino de su país. El hecho de que la eliminatoria se decida en el pabellón de A Malata puede ser un factor favorable al equipo ferrolano, que contará con el apoyo de su incondicional afición en el pabellón ferrolano.

author: Kassy Akiva
title: EXCLUSIVE: Vivek Ramaswamy Reacts To Being Chased Out Of Pro-Hamas Protest Near DNC
text:
— News — EXCLUSIVE: Vivek Ramaswamy Reacts To Being Chased Out Of Pro-Hamas Protest Near DNC 'I was hoping that would open up interesting dialogue, but then I started to get called racist.'
By Kassy Akiva • Aug 22, 2024 DailyWire.com • Facebook
X
Mail
Vivek Ramaswamy outside the site of the DNC / The Daily Wire CHICAGO—Former Republican presidential contender Vivek Ramaswamy said he thought he would be able to have a “dialogue” with activists demonstrating outside the Democratic National Convention, but he was instead called a “racist” and chased out of the pro-Hamas protest, he told The Daily Wire.
Ramaswamy said he made a surprise appearance at the protest in Union Park to see what was happening with his own eyes.
“Whether or not you agree with me, whether or not you like me, you have the right to speak your mind as long as it’s peaceful,” Ramaswamy said. “I don’t exactly know what happened at the end there.”
EXCLUSIVE: @VivekGRamaswamy reacts to getting mobbed at the pro-Hamas protest outside the DNC
“I was hoping to have a dialogue…then I got called a racist.” pic.twitter.com/bT7mfp1MnB
— Daily Wire (@realDailyWire) August 23, 2024
As Ramaswamy was being escorted away by his security detail, protesters chanted, “Racist go home,” as a fight broke out when radical activists attacked a man with an American flag who stepped in to support Ramaswamy.
Anti-Israel protesters have been gathering at the park and marching to the security barrier outside the DNC to voice their opposition to Israel every night of the DNC. Protesters clashed with police during several of the marches.
Ramaswamy said he was disappointed that many of the protesters were unwilling to have an open dialogue.
“I do care about the well-being and plight of people everywhere in the world, including in Gaza, but we can’t have this conversation ignoring the reality of the event that precipitated it, which was of course an attack on Israel’s sovereignty and its own people,” he said.
“I was hoping that would open up interesting dialogue,” he added. “But then I started to get called racist.”
One of the protesters who confronted Ramaswamy was Hatem Abudayyeh, who openly supports Hamas and had his home raided by the FBI in 2010 for “material support of terrorism.” Abudayyeh told Ramaswamy to leave, calling him a “racist Zionist pig.”
“The good news is we are in America, and so we all actually get to express ourselves,” Ramaswamy quipped back.
WATCH: Vivek Ramaswamy Chased Out By Angry Mob At Anti-Israel Protest Outside DNC
Ramaswamy said he enjoyed buying a newspaper called “The Communist” for five dollars before he was swarmed by protesters demanding he leave.
“My favorite exchange was buying, with U.S. dollars — though they accept Venmo as well — this communist literature from this guy,” Ramaswamy said. “Kind of interesting.”
The Trump campaign surrogate said he plans to read the paper, but likely not from “cover to cover.”
Ramaswamy said he thinks there were more active protests outside the DNC than the Republican National Convention because people who lean left tend to be more “chaotic.”
“I think the left in part is based on chaos, and I don’t mean that in a negative way. Conservatives tend to order their universe based on order and liberals and the far left tend to order their view on disorder.”
At the protest, attendees were carrying a mix of Palestinian flags, Black Liberation flags, communist flags, and a Hezbollah flag.
The anti-Israel protesters are expected to march outside the DNC Thursday night, where Vice President Kamala Harris will officially accept the Democratic presidential nomination.

author: Belga Belga
title: Europa League - Anderlecht s'écroule en onze minutes contre Hoffenheim et devra jouer les barrages
text:
Europa League - Anderlecht s'écroule en onze minutes contre Hoffenheim et devra jouer les barrages
Anderlecht devra disputer les barrages de l'Europa League après sa défaite 3-4 contre Hoffenheim lors de la 8e et dernière journée de la phase de ligue jeudi. Un résultat qui éjecte les Anderlechtois, 10e avec 14 pts, du top 8 lors de cette ultime journée. Twente ou Fenerbahce sera l'adversaire des Bruxellois pour une place en huitièmes de finale.
BelgaAgence
- Publié le 30-01-2025 à 23h36
- à Anderlecht, Belgique
Une semaine après avoir manqué une première occasion de se qualifier à Plzen, Anderlecht a cette fois mieux entamé les débats face à Hoffenheim. Il n'a fallu que 82 secondes au RSCA pour se créer sa première occasion mais Luiz Vazquez n'a pas cadré sur un centre de Francis Amuzu (2e).
L'Argentin s'est montré ensuite plus efficace en ouvrant le score d'une frappe enroulée du pied gauche en pleine lucarne (18e, 1-0). Dominateur avec notamment un tir de Yari Verschaeren sur le poteau (25e), le Sporting a pourtant été rejoint sur une des rares incursions allemandes dans son rectangle. Sur un corner, Killian Sardella a dévié la tête de Robin Hranac dans ses propres filets (41e, 1-1).

author: @ukrpravda_news
title: NATO Summit: Biden promises continued support to Ukraine | Ukrainska Pravda
text:
NATO Summit: Biden promises continued support to Ukraine Ivashkiv Olena — Friday, 12 July 2024, 06:45 2640
Joe Biden and Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the NATO Summit in Washington. Photo: Getty Images US President Joe Biden has reaffirmed his commitment to continuing the United States' policy of global leadership in supporting Ukraine and strengthening NATO, emphasising that it is a matter of national security for the US.
Source: Biden at a final press conference after the NATO summit in Washington on Thursday; Ukrainform
Quote: "I will not walk away from Ukraine. I will keep NATO strong. That's exactly what we did, and exactly what we'll continue to do now."
Advertisement: Details: Biden emphasised that the future of US policy depends on the American people, who will make their choice in November.
However, Biden warned that this is much more than a political issue, "it is a national security issue".
He added that it is not about his political campaign but about the coming decades.
Advertisement: In this context, he recalled how his predecessor Donald Trump refused to commit to Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty, which is considered the cornerstone of collective security. In addition, Biden recalled that Trump called the Russian dictator Putin a "genius".
Background:
On 11 July, 23 states and the EU signed a bilateral security agreement with Ukraine. Support UP or become our patron !
Subjects: Biden NATO aid for Ukraine Advertisement:

author: @ABRLive
title: Noel's Weekend Winners: The Sky's the Limit on Pegasus Day | America's Best Racing
text:
Noel’s Weekend Winners: The Sky’s the Limit on Pegasus Day
Gambling
Welcome to Noel Michaels’ Weekend Winners, the place to go for weekend best bets and spot plays from veteran handicapper and tournament-play pioneer Noel Michaels. Check back every week for a couple of highlighted selections designed to help you cash a few bets and make some money. Noel's selections have been featured just about everywhere horse racing picks can be found, including in print in the Daily Racing Form, The HorsePlayer Magazine and American Turf Monthly, online at DRF.com, Twinspires.com and USRacing.com, from the paddock on-track at Arlington International Racecourse, and on the air on HRTV, TVG, NYC OTB Extra, NYRA's SatuTalking Horses, and on broadcast TV on WAVE-3 Louisville, ABC KOLO-8 in Reno, Nevada, and channel 72 Long Island Cablevision.
Six Beginner Betting Tools
- Start simple with an
easy guide for how to bet on horse racing. - Not sure what that word means?
Horse racing terminology is a language of its own. Allow us translate for you - What the heck is a speed figure? This
beginner’s guide to speed figureshas everything you need to know. - Betting on horse racing can be intimidating. Team ABR put together some
Dos and Don’ts for the new fan getting started betting on racing. - We all make mistakes when it comes to betting on horse racing,
here are eight lessons learned from experience. - Figure out how much each bet will cost in advance with our
Gambling Calculator, presented by NYRA Bets.
Saturday, Jan. 25
Top older horses take center stage this weekend as Gulfstream Park hosts its blockbuster Pegasus World Cup day 13-race card on Saturday, Jan. 25. It’s one of the days of winter racing that truly can’t be missed. Best of luck and enjoy the races.
Gulfstream Park, Race 12, $1 million Pegasus World Cup Turf Invitational Stakes Presented by Qatar Racing, 4:55 p.m. ET
A full field of top turf runners will go to post for this Grade 1 going 1 1/8 miles on the turf course. Talent runs deep in this race and the key to finding the top finisher(s) could be the distance, which might prove to be a little too short for some of the top challengers in the field, including morning-line favorites #5 Integration and #7 Nations Pride. As the winner of the 2024 Arlington Million Stakes and the 2023 Canadian International (both Grade 1s at 1 ¼ miles), Nations Pride still might be able to win this race at a distance that is short of optimum, but he won’t be the top pick. The horse to beat will be #3 Mi Hermano Ramon, who is in career-best form and has emerged as one of the West’s top turf horses in this distance range. He won Del Mar’s Grade 2 Seabiscuit Handicap in November and came within a half a length of holding off Johannes last time out when second in the Grade 2 San Gabriel Stakes at [Santa Anita](https://www.americasbestracing.net/tracks/santa-anita-park). Johannes has been nearly unbeatable for the last year and was exiting a close second-place finish in the [FanDuel Breeders' Cup Mile Presented by PDJF](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2024-fanduel-breeders-cup-mile-presented-pdjf) in his last race. If Johannes was entered in this race, he would be the favorite. Mi Hermano Ramon finished three-quarters of a length behind Johannes, and he’s listed at bargain 8-1 odds on the morning line. After Mi Hermano Ramon and Nations Pride, the other horse you want on your tickets is #4 [Win for the Money](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/win-the-money), who won the Grade 1 [Rogers Woodbine Mile](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2024-rogers-woodbine-mile-s) last September and exits a good stakes tune-up on this course in his last race.
The Play: Bet on #3 [Mi Hermano Ramon](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/mi-hermano-ramon) (8-1) to win and play him in exacta and trifecta boxes with #4 [Win for the Money](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/win-the-money) (12-1) and #7 [Nations Pride](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/nations-pride-ire) (2-1).
[Gulfstream Park](http://www.americasbestracing.net/tracks/gulfstream-park), Race 13, $3 million [Pegasus World Cup Invitational Stakes](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2025-pegasus-world-cup-invitational-s), 5:40 p.m. ET
This weekend’s headline Grade 1 event drew a full field of older horses set to race 1 1/8 miles on the Gulfstream main track for a purse of $3 million. The lineup features #9 [Mystik Dan](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/mystik-dan), the winner of the 2024 [Kentucky Derby Presented by Woodford Reserve](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2024-kentucky-derby-presented-woodford-reserve) who will be making his 4-year-old debut in a tough spot. His name recognition is very likely to make him an underlay and he doesn’t have the recent form to deserve inclusion on your tickets. The other big name in the field is 2023 [Longines Breeders’ Cup Classic](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2023-longines-breeders-cup-classic) winner #4 [White Abarrio](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/white-abarrio), a horse who has been making his way back into best form lately for Gulfstream’s leading trainer, [Saffie Joseph Jr.](https://www.americasbestracing.net/trainers/saffie-joseph-jr), following a tough first half of 2024 when in the care of a different barn. He suffered a brutal trip when losing Gulfstream’s Grade 3 [Mr. Prospector Stakes](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2024-mr-prospector-s) at seven furlongs Dec. 28 but is now prepped and ready for this return to 1 1/8 miles with a record of six wins and a second in eight prior lifetime outings at Gulfstream Park. Gulfstream’s dirt races at this distance have been notorious for a decade of favoring the inside posts, and White Abarrio is well-drawn in post 4. Another contender that will benefit from a good inside post is #2 [Saudi Crown](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/saudi-crown), who shows plenty of high speed figures up and down his past performances the last two years. Saudi Crown is fast, and he could loom the controlling speed in this race from an inside draw, which makes him an extraordinarily dangerous threat to go wire-to-wire. The other intriguing challenger in this field is #11 [Locked](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/locked), a horse who seemed destined to contend in the 2024 Triple Crown races until an injury temporarily sidetracked his career. He has come back with a vengeance lately, however, with two wins including the Grade 2 [Cigar Mile Handicap Presented by Twinspires.com](https://www.americasbestracing.net/races/2024-cigar-mile-h-presented-twinspirescom). From a better post, he might’ve been the top choice, but even from post 11 it’s impossible to ignore his seemingly unlimited upside.
The Play: Bet #4 [White Abarrio](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/white-abarrio) (3-1) to win and play him in exacta and trifecta boxes with #2 [Saudi Crown](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/saudi-crown) (9-2) and #11 [Locked](https://www.americasbestracing.net/horses/locked) (5-2).

author: Agenzia ANSA
title: Mediterraneo, il livello del mare sta salendo a velocità tripla - Terra e Poli - Ansa.it
text: In certe zone del Mediterraneo il livello del mare sta salendo a velocità tripla rispetto alle stime fatte finora: oltre 38.500 chilometri quadrati di coste saranno presto a rischio inondazione. Lo indica lo studio firmato da tre ricercatori italiani delle sedi di Roma e Bologna dell'Istituto Nazionale di Geofisica e Vulcanologia e dell'Università olandese di Radboud, pubblicato %20AppleWebKit/537.36%20(KHTML,%20like%20Gecko)%20Chrome/120.0.0.0%20Safari/537.36&ssu=&ssv=&ssw=&ssx=W10=)sulla rivista Environmental Research Letters. Per l'Italia, le coste più a rischio sono quelle di Friuli Venezia-Giulia, Veneto, Emilia-Romagna e Puglia settentrionale per il versante adriatico, insieme a quelle di Toscana, Lazio e in parte della Sardegna per quello tirrenico. La causa di questa modifica al rialzo delle proiezioni sull'aumento del livello del mare sta nel fenomeno della subsidenza. "La subsidenza, cioè il lento movimento verso il basso del suolo dovuto a cause naturali o antropiche, ha un ruolo cruciale nell'accelerare l'aumento del livello del mare lungo le coste, innescato dal riscaldamento globale a partire dal 1880", osserva Marco Anzidei, dell'Ingv, dello studio con Antonio Vecchio ed Enrico Serpelloni. "Le nostre analisi mostrano che, proprio a causa della subsidenza, in alcune zone del Mediterraneo il livello del mare sta aumentando a una velocità quasi tripla rispetto alle zone stabili", aggiunge Vecchio dell'Università di Radboud e primo autore della ricerca. Nella ricerca, osserva Serpelloni, sono stati utilizzati i dati dei sistemi di navigazione satellitare, che permettono di calcolare in maniera estremamente precisa le velocità di spostamento verticale del suolo. Alla luce di questi dati, i tre ricercatori hanno ricalcolato le attuali proiezioni fino al 2150 in 265 zone del Mediterraneo. "Nelle aree risultate più a rischio ci saranno maggiori impatti sull'ambiente, sulle attività umane e sulle infrastrutture", dice Anzidei: "È quindi necessario - conclude - intraprendere azioni concrete a sostegno delle popolazioni costiere". Riproduzione riservata © Copyright ANSA

author: EFE
title: La selección española y el Real Madrid copan las nominaciones al Balón de Oro | El Periódico de España
text: El brasileño Vinicius, el francés Kylian Mbappé y el alemán Toni Kroos optarán al Balón de Oro de 2024, dentro de una lista de treinta aspirantes con mucha presencia de estrellas del Real Madrid, campeón de la última Liga de Campeones. Entre los nominados anunciados este miércoles también figuran nombres como Erling Haaland, Martin Ödegaard, Declan Rice, Vitinha, Harry Kane, Federico Valverde o Antonio Rüdiger. Seis futbolistas españoles aspiran al Balón de Oro de este año tras el triunfo en la Eurocopa este verano -Nico Williams, Dani Olmo, Rodri, Dani Carvajal, Lamine Yamal y Alejandro Grimaldo- y la presencia latinoamericana la encabeza la campeona de América, Argentina, con el portero Emiliano Martínez y el delantero Lautaro Martínez. En una gala en la que por primera vez desde 2003 no estarán nominados ni Cristiano Ronaldo ni Leo Messi, el español del Barcelona Lamine Yamal se colocará, con 17 años cumplidos en julio pasado, como el jugador más joven en ser nominado al Balón de Oro. Lamine Yamal y CUbarsí Su nombre también aparece en las candidaturas al Trofeo Kopa al mejor jugador joven, junto a figuras como Pau Cubarsí (Barcelona) o Arda Guler (Real Madrid). En la categoría de porteros, la lista de diez nominados incluye al español Unai Simón, de nuevo al argentino Emiliano Martínez y el suizo del Inter Yann Sommer, entre otros. Respecto al trofeo de entrenadores, el dominio es sobre todo español, con Xabi Alonso, Pep Guardiola y del seleccionador Luis de la Fuente. A ellos se medirán los italianos Carlo Ancelotti (Real Madrid) y Gian Piero Gasperini (Atalanta) y el seleccionador argentino Lionel Scaloni. Los premios se entregarán en una gala en París el próximo 28 de octubre.

author: Redacción
title: Las palmeras de Huelva, libres del picudo rojo
text:
La vigilancia constante y sistemática y la aplicación de tratamientos fitosanitarios han sido las claves para que el Ayuntamiento de Huelva haya conseguido neutralizar la plaga del Picudo Rojo en las palmeras de la ciudad.
Sin tener que lamentar ninguna baja en lo que va de 2024, la concejala de Infraestructura y Servicios Públicos, Mariló Ponce se muestra sin embargo prudente porque “aunque los protocolos que estamos siguiendo nos permiten actuar preventivamente y detectar la presencia del insecto en sus primeras fases de infestación, ayudándonos a salvar las planta y evitar futuras infestaciones en la actualidad la palmera canaria está pasando por uno de los peores momentos de salud desde que se instaló en todo el territorio nacional, con especial virulencia en comunidades vecinas, como Extremadura donde cientos de palmeras están sucumbiendo a la plaga”.
El problema continúa por lo tanto “latente” y “desde el Ayuntamiento de Huelva vamos a seguir trabajando para la conservación de nuestro palmeral”. El protocolo de actuación consiste principalmente en inyecciones al estipe o estípite de la palmera, una técnica que supone un tratamiento individualizado en cada ejemplar administrando un producto fitosanitario y nutritivo directamente al sistema vascular de cada ejemplar, evitando con esta metodología la dispersión ambiental y garantizando una dosis precisa dependiendo de
las características de cada planta a tratar. En concreto, son 235 ejemplares de Phoenix canariensis los que se han tratado, siendo en esta ocasión el tercero de los cuatro tratamientos estipulados y recomendados anualmente.
Cada 60 o 70 días, se realizan aplicaciones, además de dos tratamientos de choque, uno en primavera y otro a finales de verano, para inmunizar los ejemplares frente a nuevos ataques.
Se trata de un tratamiento enmarcado en la endoterapia que utiliza sustancias nutritivas que facilitan además la revitalización y activación de las defensas de la propia palmera. El objetivo del Ayuntamiento de Huelva es combatir las plagas desde una postura lo más ecológica posible, reduciendo al mínimo el uso de productos y siempre autorizados por Sanidad Vegetal.
Con esta metodología se prescinde además de los tradicionales tratamientos aéreos, evitando pulverizaciones o aspersiones de productos, minimizando los riesgos sobre el medio ambiente y reforzando la seguridad, ya que resultan totalmente inocuos para la salud de las personas y animales, pudiéndose utilizar a cualquier hora del día.

author: @CentralChartsEN
title: Celebrity & Lifestyle Expert Emily Loftiss Inspires a 'New Year, New You' on TipsOnTV
text:
Celebrity & Lifestyle Expert Emily Loftiss Inspires a 'New Year, New You' on TipsOnTV
- 34
Top Stylist Shares Expert Tips for Setting and Sticking to New Year's Resolutions.
ATLANTA, GEORGIA / ACCESS Newswire / January 23, 2025 / The beginning of each new year offers an opportunity to reset and create a fresh path for the future. This time of year often means setting resolutions and starting anew, whether it involves finances, family, or health. Celebrity stylist, Emily Loftiss shares practical tips to inspire positive changes for achieving a "new you" in the new year. As the founder of Everyday Glam, she helps individuals find ways to prioritize health and happiness, even within a busy lifestyle.Lifestyle Expert Emily Loftiss Shares Ideas to Create a New You in the New Year
Celebrity Stylist Emily Loftiss with New Year, New You Inspiration
A SUGGESTION TO GET FIT
Studies show that most people abandon their New Year's resolutions by mid-February, with an 80% drop-off rate. The key to maintaining fitness goals is finding a program that fits individual needs. F45 Training offers a unique combination of HIIT, circuit training, and functional training designed to keep participants motivated and engaged. In just 45 minutes, F45 delivers a full-body workout that produces real results. Through January 31, F45 is offering a special deal for new members: three classes for just $30 at select studio locations. For more information, visit f45training.com.
GET PEOPLE EXCITED FOR THE NEW YEAR
The new year is the perfect time to include travel in any set of resolutions. Viva by Wyndham All-Inclusive Resorts, part of Wyndham's Trademark Collection, provides the ideal getaway with locations in Mexico, the Bahamas, and the Dominican Republic. These all-inclusive resorts offer sprawling beaches, full-service spas, diverse dining options, daily activities, and vibrant evening entertainment. Currently, the resorts are offering deals of up to 30% off for the next all-inclusive vacation. For more details, visit TrademarkHotels.com.
START THE NEW YEAR STRONG FINANCIALLY
Kickstart the year with a Refund Advance loan available at participating H&R Block offices. Clients can receive up to $4,000 within minutes of filing taxes, with no interest, loan fees, or impact on credit scores. Unlike other providers that require waiting until the IRS opens in late January, H&R Block enables early access to funds. Schedule an appointment today at hrblock.com.
HELP PEOPLE KEEP FINANCIAL RESOLUTIONS
Spruce, an all-in-one mobile banking app created by H&R Block, is designed to help users manage their money more effectively. The app offers features such as 3.50% APY on savings when opting in, the ability to set savings goals, automatic spending tracking with a Watchlist, and personalized saving recommendations for refunds. Spruce has no sign-up fees, no monthly fees, and no minimum balance requirements. Learn more and sign up at SpruceMoney.com.
